_header: God that art of mights most / Father Son and Holy Ghost
_description: ‘Þe Prikke of loue’, a free translation of St. Edmund’s Speculum — 1082 lines in couplets

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
God þat art of miȝtes mostffader and Sone and holi
                    gost…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þat he haþ ordeyned for vre solaceLord bring vs
                    þider for þi grace AmenÞus endeþ þe spore of
                    loueGod graunt vs þe blisse of heuene aboue
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title:
Her beginneþ þe Prikke of loue / Þat profitable is to soule
                    be houe (see 1952)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 1.
EETS
         o.s. 98 (1892; repr. 1973): 268-97.

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
LOrd þat art of miȝtes mostffader and sone and
                    holigost…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…Þus endeþe spore of loueGod graunt us þe
                    blisse of heuen aboue
